intro: Hieracium tubuliflorum, commonly known as the meadow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped with rough, hairy surfaces, and the flowers consist of yellow disk florets surrounded by yellow to reddish ray florets. It is often found in open habitats and can spread rapidly due to its ability to produce numerous seeds.
